profile.name: OSSS Amateur Sports Profile
profile.description: Constraint profile for amateur and semi-professional leagues. Balances competitive integrity with participant availability and resource constraints.

required.rationale: Teams cannot be in two places at once.
Venues can only host one match at a time.
Amateur players often balance sport with work/study. 48 hours provides adequate recovery and schedule flexibility.
Amateur leagues typically share venues with other organizations and face booking constraints.

recommended.rationale: Competitive fairness requires reasonably balanced schedules, though some flexibility is acceptable.
Amateur players typically cover their own travel costs. Minimizing distance reduces financial burden.
Most amateur players can handle 2 games in tournament formats, but prefer single-game days for regular season.
Variety in matchups maintains competitive interest and fairness across the season.

metadata.adoptionImpact: Amateur leagues gain professional-grade scheduling with appropriate constraints for non-professional contexts
